channel.title: Comments on: First Look at IE 10
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: I've installed IE9, but I'm getting non responsive on my favorite sites. I guess I will have to go back to IE8 :(
item.content:encoded: I’ve installed IE9, but I’m getting non responsive on my favorite sites. I guess I will have to go back to IE8 üôÅ

item.title: By: document management
item.dc:creator: document management
item.content:encoded:
I hope IE will just work this time. We have so many versions of it and…man I can tell you, it cost us to much to support it than all other browsers together.

If this is the final great version of IE, i wont quit my job…yet üôÇ

item.title: By: EugeneK
item.dc:creator: EugeneK
item.content:encoded:
First of all cheers for finally making IE that will support HTML5 and CSS3 alike other browsers could for more than year.

Second of all cheers for making Google/Mozilla cry watching IE10 with hardware acceleration comparison to current Chrome and Firefox versions. No one will mind that IE10 will be released after Chrome and Firefox will already have tested and current version of their browsers with hardware acceleration.
